”⁵ Irenaeus :—a Christian Bishop and Martyr of the second century, born in Greece, and educated by Polycarp, who sent him on amission into Gaul, where he becamea distinguished member of the church at Lyons, under Photinus. On the martyrdom of this prelate, Irenaeus was appointed his successor in the diocese in 174, and presided in that capacity at two Coun- cils held at Lyons, in one of which the Gnostic heresy was condemned, and in the other the Quartodecimum.
